oracle.pg.nosql

Class OracleVertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.nosql.OracleElement
      • oracle.pg.nosql.OracleVertex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, OracleElementBase, OracleVertexBase, Element, Host, Vertex

    public class OracleVertex
extends OracleElement
implements OracleVertexBase, java.lang.Comparable
    This class implements the Blueprints Vertex interface on top of the supported backend database.

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Edge addEdge(java.lang.String label,
                                             com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex inVertex)
        This method adds an outgoing edge from this vertex to the inVertex with the provided edge label. To persist the changes done to this vertex into the database, the underlying property graph must be commited.
        Parameters:
        label - the label of the edge
        inVertex - the in vertex of the new edge to create for this vertex
        Returns:
        an Edge object.

      • addEdge

                                      java.lang.String... edgeLabels)

        Specified by:
        edges in interface Vertex
        Parameters:
        direction - The incident direction of the edges to retrieve off this vertex
        edgeLabels - The labels of the edges to retrieve. If no labels are provided, then get all edges.

      • getInstance

        public static OracleVertex getInstance(OraclePropertyGraph opg,
                                       java.lang.Long vid)
        Returns an instance of OracleVertex from the underlying graph
        Parameters:
        opg - the property graph where the OracleVertex instance will be obtained
        vid - the id of the vertex
        Returns:
        a OracleVertex object.

      • getInstance

        public static OracleVertex getInstance(OraclePropertyGraph opg,
                                       java.lang.Long vid,
                                       boolean bCreateIfAbsentFromCache)
        Returns an instance of OracleVertex. If there is no match in the cache and bCreateIfAbsentFromCache is false, then a NULL value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        opg - the property graph where the OracleVertex instance will be obtained
        vid - the id of the vertex
        bCreateIfAbsentFromCache - if false, returns a NULL value if there is no match in the cache.
        Returns:
        a OracleVertex object.

      • getInstance

        public static OracleVertex getInstance(OraclePropertyGraph opg,
                                       java.lang.Long vid,
                                       boolean bCreateIfAbsentFromCache,
                                       boolean bSkipStoreToCache)
        Returns an instance of OracleVertex. If there is no match in the cache and bCreateIfAbsentFromCache is false, then a NULL value will be returned.If the skipStoreToCache is true, then the vertex will not be stored into the cache.
        Parameters:
        opg - the property graph where the OracleVertex instance will be obtained
        vid - the id of the vertex
        bCreateIfAbsentFromCache - if false, returns a NULL value if there is no match in the cache.
        bSkipStoreToCache - if true, the vertex instance will not be stored into the cache.
        Returns:
        a OracleVertex object.

      • getVertices

        public java.lang.Iterable<com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex> getVertices(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Direction direction,
                                                                       java.lang.String... labels)
        Return the vertices adjacent to the vertex according to the provided direction and edge labels.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the edges of the adjacent vertices
        labels - the labels of the edges of the adjacent vertices
        Returns:
        an iterable of adjacent vertices

      • property

        public <V> OracleVertexProperty<V> property(java.lang.String key)
        Get the VertexProperty for the provided key. If the property does not exist, return VertexProperty.empty(). If there are more than one vertex properties for the provided key, then throw Vertex.Exceptions.multiplePropertiesExistForProvidedKey(java.lang.String).
        Specified by:
        property in interface Element
        Specified by:
        property in interface Vertex
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the vertex property to get
        Returns:
        the retrieved vertex property

      • property

        public OracleVertexProperty property(java.lang.String key,
                                     java.lang.Object value)
        Assign a key/value property to the element.
        Specified by:
        property in interface Element
        Specified by:
        property in interface Vertex
        Parameters:
        key - key of an attribute (K/V pair)
        value - value of an attribute (K/V pair)

      • property

        public <V> VertexProperty<V> property(VertexProperty.Cardinality cardinality,
                                      java.lang.String key,
                                      V value,
                                      java.lang.Object... keyValues)
        Create a new vertex property. If the cardinality is VertexProperty.Cardinality.single, then set the key to the value. If the cardinality is VertexProperty.Cardinality.list, then add a new value to the key. If the cardinality is VertexProperty.Cardinality.set, then only add a new value if that value doesn't already exist for the key. If the value already exists for the key, add the provided key value vertex property properties to it.
        Specified by:
        property in interface OracleVertexBase
        Specified by:
        property in interface Vertex

      • query

        public com.tinkerpop.blueprints.VertexQuery query()
        Generate a query object that can be used to fine tune which edges/vertices are retrieved that are incident/adjacent to this vertex.
        Returns:
        a VertexQuery object with methods for constraining which data is pulled from the underlying graph

      • remove

        public void remove()
        This method removes this vertex from its underlying graph. To persist the changes done to this vertex into the database, the underlying property graph must be commited.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Element

        Specified by:
